headline: Davos CEO Brief for Monday, January 19, 2026
summary: WSJ Leadership Institute President Alan Murray speaks with powerful CEOs and highlights some of the top issues being discussed at the World Economic Forum in Davos this week—from geopolitical challenges to the opportunities ahead in 2026.

headline: Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach On How To Win the Cyber Arms Race
summary: Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach speaks with the WSJ Leadership Institute’s Alan Murray at the World Economic Forum in Davos on how AI is helping the “good guys” fight cybercrime—and what he sees ahead for the global economy in 2026.

raw.headline: Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach On How To Win the Cyber Arms Race

headline: How Trump's credit card rate cap would impact Visa & Mastercard
summary: President Trump has proposed implementing a 10% cap on credit card interest rates. Argus Research director of financial services research Stephen Biggar sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to explain how Trump's rate cap would affect names like Visa (V) and Mastercard (MA). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Does Lemon's Bitcoin Credit Card Hint at V's Next Crypto Growth Lane?
summary: A Bitcoin-backed credit card on Visa's network lets users spend pesos while holding crypto, highlighting a new path for crypto-linked credit growth.

raw.headline: Does Lemon's Bitcoin Credit Card Hint at V's Next Crypto Growth Lane?
raw.summary: A Bitcoin-backed credit card on Visa's network lets users spend pesos while holding crypto, highlighting a new path for crypto-linked credit growth.

headline: Trump credit card cap would cause once in a lifetime battle from banks
summary: While major bank stocks fall after reporting their fourth quarter earnings, President Trump's suggested 10% cap on credit card fees continues to weigh on the financial sector (XLF) and credit lenders. HSBC Head of US Financials Research Saul Martinez told Yahoo Finance on Tuesday that a policy like this would make the credit card industry largely "unprofitable." Whalen Global Advisors Chairman Chris Whalen explains how bank executives would respond to this type of legislation. Also catch Chris Whalen weigh in on the performance of Big Bank stocks in comparison to smaller counterparts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach explains the future of global spending
summary: From shifting consumer sentiment to AI’s growing role in financial security, credit card company leader Michael Miebach looks at how the business of payments is changing.
